feed.title: Bisanz Lab Website
feed.subtitle: Website of the Bisanz Lab interested in the gut microbiome, drugs, toxins, and diet.

entry.title: Shane receives NIGMS T32
entry.content: Shane has been appointed to the inaugural cohort of PSU’s new T32 training program supported by the National Institute of General Medical Sciences. Read more about the BIOMS T32 here.
entry.summary: Shane has been appointed to the inaugural cohort of PSU’s new T32 training program supported by the National Institute of General Medical Sciences. Read more about the BIOMS T32 here.

entry.title: Kerim’s manuscript is out in bioinformatics

link.title: Kerim’s manuscript is out in bioinformatics

entry.content: Who said undergraduates can’t have their own projects? Kerim’s first author paper featuring many members of the lab is out this week in Bioinformatics. StrainR2 is a highly efficient tool for quantifying microbes at the strain level in synthetic microbial communities. Read it here.
entry.summary: Who said undergraduates can’t have their own projects? Kerim’s first author paper featuring many members of the lab is out this week in Bioinformatics. StrainR2 is a highly efficient tool for quantifying microbes at the strain level in synthetic microbial communities. Read it here.

entry.title: Min Soo receives NIAID F31
entry.content: After a long wait, Min Soo has been awarded a Ruth L. Kirschstein National Research Service Award Individual Predoctoral Fellowship (F31) from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease. Congrats Min Soo!
entry.summary: After a long wait, Min Soo has been awarded a Ruth L. Kirschstein National Research Service Award Individual Predoctoral Fellowship (F31) from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease. Congrats Min Soo!

entry.title: Susan’s manuscript is out in CHM

link.title: Susan’s manuscript is out in CHM

entry.content: Susan’s valiant effort to design and then deconstruct a synthetic microbiota to inhibit C. difficile is out this month in Cell Host & Microbe. Read more about it at the Scientist.
entry.summary: Susan’s valiant effort to design and then deconstruct a synthetic microbiota to inhibit C. difficile is out this month in Cell Host & Microbe. Read more about it at the Scientist.
